title: Technology-Enhanced Collaborative Mathematics Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level mathematical concepts and basic problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: Designing online asynchronous classes to promote collaborative learning activities in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can share math problem-solving strategies with peers using collaboration tools within an LMS and achieve over 80% participation.

Learners can evaluate their ability to solve complex math problems through technology-based collaborative activities, demonstrating a 20% or greater improvement in achievement from pre- to post-assessment.
Learners can assess mathematical communication skills by exchanging peer feedback in online discussion forums and achieve a feedback implementation rate of 75% or higher.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
